  22. (* To copy the ML code fragments *)

  24. ‌type line_tracker = {
  25.   file : string;
  26.   oc : out_channel;
  27.   ic : in_channel;
  28.   mutable cur_line : int;
  29. }

  31. ‌let open_tracker file oc = {
  32.   file = file;
  33.   oc = oc;
  34.   ic = open_in_bin file;
  35.   cur_line = 1;
  36. }

  38. ‌let close_tracker tr = close_in_noerr tr.ic

  40. ‌let update_tracker tr =
  41.   fprintf tr.oc "\n";
  42.   flush tr.oc;
  43.   let cr_seen = ref false in
  44.   try while true do
  45.     match input_char tr.ic with
  46.     | '\010' when not !cr_seen -> tr.cur_line <- tr.cur_line + 1;
  47.     | '\013' -> cr_seen := true; tr.cur_line <- tr.cur_line + 1;
  48.     | _ -> cr_seen := false;
  49.   done with End_of_file ->
  50.   fprintf tr.oc "# %d \"%s\"\n" (tr.cur_line+1) tr.file

  52. ‌let copy_buffer = Bytes.create 1024

  54. ‌let copy_chars_unix ic oc start stop =
  55.   let n = ref (stop - start) in
  56.   while !n > 0 do
  57.     let m = input ic copy_buffer 0 (Int.min !n 1024) in
  58.     output oc copy_buffer 0 m;
  59.     n := !n - m
  60.   done

  62. ‌let copy_chars_win32 ic oc start stop =
  63.   for _i = start to stop - 1 do
  64.     let c = input_char ic in
  65.     if c <> '\r' then output_char oc c
  66.   done

  68. ‌let copy_chars =
  69.   match Sys.os_type with
  70.     "Win32" | "Cygwin" -> copy_chars_win32
  71.   | _       -> copy_chars_unix

  73. ‌let copy_chunk ic oc trl loc add_parens =
  74.   if loc.start_pos < loc.end_pos || add_parens then begin
  75.     fprintf oc "# %d \"%s\"\n" loc.start_line loc.loc_file;
  76.     if add_parens then begin
  77.       for _i = 1 to loc.start_col - 1 do output_char oc ' ' done;
  78.       output_char oc '(';
  79.     end else begin
  80.       for _i = 1 to loc.start_col do output_char oc ' ' done;
  81.     end;
  82.     seek_in ic loc.start_pos;
  83.     copy_chars ic oc loc.start_pos loc.end_pos;
  84.     if add_parens then output_char oc ')';
  85.     update_tracker trl;
  86.   end

  88. (* Various memory actions *)

  90. ‌let output_mem_access oc i = fprintf oc "lexbuf.Lexing.lex_mem.(%d)" i

  92. ‌let output_memory_actions pref oc = function
  93.   | []  -> ()
  94.   | mvs ->
  95.       output_string oc "(* " ;
  96.   fprintf oc "L=%d " (List.length mvs) ;
  97.   List.iter
  98.     (fun mv -> match mv with
  99.     | Copy (tgt, src) ->
  100.         fprintf oc "[%d] <- [%d] ;" tgt src
  101.     | Set tgt ->
  102.         fprintf oc "[%d] <- p ; " tgt)
  103.     mvs ;
  104.   output_string oc " *)\n" ;
  105.   List.iter
  106.     (fun mv -> match mv with
  107.     | Copy (tgt, src) ->
  108.         fprintf oc
  109.           "%s%a <- %a ;\n"
  110.           pref output_mem_access tgt output_mem_access src
  111.     | Set tgt ->
  112.         fprintf oc "%s%a <- lexbuf.Lexing.lex_curr_pos ;\n"
  113.           pref output_mem_access tgt)
  114.     mvs

  116. let output_base_mem oc = function
  117.   | Mem i -> output_mem_access oc i
  118.   | Start -> fprintf oc "lexbuf.Lexing.lex_start_pos"
  119.   | End   -> fprintf oc  "lexbuf.Lexing.lex_curr_pos"

  121. ‌let output_tag_access oc = function
  122.   | Sum (a,0) ->
  123.       output_base_mem oc a
  124.   | Sum (a,i) ->
  125.       fprintf oc "(%a + %d)" output_base_mem a i

  127. ‌let output_env ic oc tr env =
  128.   let pref = ref "let" in
  129.   match env with
  130.   | [] -> ()
  131.   | _  ->
  132.       (* Probably, we are better with variables sorted
  133.          in apparition order *)
  134.       let env =
  135.         List.sort
  136.           (fun ((_,p1),_) ((_,p2),_) ->
  137.             Stdlib.compare p1.start_pos  p2.start_pos)
  138.           env in

  140.       List.iter
  141.         (fun ((_,pos),v) ->
  142.           fprintf oc "%s\n" !pref ;
  143.           copy_chunk ic oc tr pos false ;
  144.           begin match v with
  145.           | Ident_string (o,nstart,nend) ->
  146.               fprintf oc
  147.                 "= Lexing.sub_lexeme%s lexbuf %a %a"
  148.                 (if o then "_opt" else "")
  149.                 output_tag_access nstart output_tag_access nend
  150.           | Ident_char (o,nstart) ->
  151.               fprintf oc
  152.                 "= Lexing.sub_lexeme_char%s lexbuf %a"
  153.                 (if o then "_opt" else "")
  154.                 output_tag_access nstart
  155.           end ;
  156.           pref := "\nand")
  157.         env ;
  158.       fprintf oc " in\n"

  160. (* Output the user arguments *)
  161. let output_args oc args =
  162.   List.iter (fun x -> (output_string oc x; output_char oc ' ')) args

  164. let output_refill_handler ic oc oci = function
  165.   | None -> false
  166.   | Some location ->
  167.     output_string oc "let __ocaml_lex_refill : \
  168.                       (Lexing.lexbuf -> 'a) -> (Lexing.lexbuf -> 'a) =\n";
  169.     copy_chunk ic oc oci location true;
  170.     true

  172. (* quiet flag *)
  173. ‌let quiet_mode = ref false
